full_text: #NYFDublin returns 🙌  The first full-scale New Year’s Festival to take place in the capital since 2019!  Ireland is one of the world's top destinations to ring in the new year, it will be great to see everyone come together again 🎆  Programme of events below ⤵️ https://t.co/6ucGfRRjjU https://t.co/JPMGqJk521

New pitches and area for teenagers at #Meadowbrook #Dundrum 🙌  Part-funded by @DeptCulturelRL, this development will greatly enhance the community particularly for our young people.  All going well, it'll be up and running by September next year! https://t.co/bfx50pKI0o

I am sorry to hear the news of the death of Garry Roberts. His guitar was the heart of the sound of the Boomtown Rats as they rose to the top of the charts at home and abroad, winning fans and challenging orthodoxies along the way. My deepest condolences to his family & friends. https://t.co/tFWJKEJKwK

Many thanks to my Seanad Éireann colleagues for their Statements on this important matter today  We are all in agreement that we must support our artists and arts workers to feel safe in their workplaces  Read my full Seanad Éireann Statement here: https://t.co/QIJ91N5wfz

To everyone working in the sectors at every level, I encourage you to undertake and be certified as having completed three free online training courses:  🟢Addressing Unconscious Bias 🟢Tackling Bullying and Harassment at work 🟢Bystander Training  https://t.co/kVK0HrdVaM

As Minister, I am asking all parties in the arts, culture and creative sectors to engage with @safetocreate_ie   Organisations can sign the code and demonstrate the desire to make our workplaces safer https://t.co/S4gvNV6RiV

I was very sorry to learn today of the passing of the great Brian O’Doherty,  a leading figure in the arts for many decades not just in Ireland but also in his adopted home in New York. Suaimhneas síoraí go raibh aige. https://t.co/MV2r1huwSZ

There are 44 initiatives across 9 government departments  I'm particularly pleased that €3.8m has been allocated to Traveller initiatives & services   Re. @DeptCulturelRL, €12m will go towards increasing sports participation for young people.  https://t.co/2I6pkSfq8a

Government has just published a €54.5m action plan to support communities at grassroots level  The Dormant Account Action Plan 2023 is aimed at disadvantaged communities and vulnerable groups across the country

There's huge interest in our Basic Income for the Arts initiative internationally  Today I discussed details of this ground-breaking intervention with UK Parliamentarians and unions   The initiative shows the value Ireland places on artistic practices   https://t.co/QFvHQoEnI7 https://t.co/wxcii2YQOD

Today's announcements follow recommendations in the Night Time Economy Taskforce Report  A group I set up to help rejuvenate Ireland's cultural nightlife scene  My officials & I will continue to work closely with the sector as it transforms  Lots done, more to come!
In Budget 2023, I secured €6m for the night-time economy  €2m of this will be allocated towards sound proofing upgrades for venues  This can also help prepare for a transition to later opening hours

Today's news on licensing reform is a significant step for Ireland's night-time economy  I'm also announcing 9 towns & cities chosen for the new Night-Time Advisor pilot initiative:  🟢Cork 🟢Dublin 🟢Galway 🟢Limerick 🟢Kilkenny 🟢Sligo 🟢Longford 🟢Drogheda 🟢Buncrana https://t.co/j4VvZOaJzv

Many thanks to the @IrishArtsCenter team for the meeting and tour today  Great to hear all about the centre's operations and see the performance & exhibition spaces  Maud Cotter's exhibition is truly thought-provoking 💚 https://t.co/dNwlmTv5R8

.@Aisling_Irish is a vital facility for the Irish diaspora in #NY on the Emerald Mile #Yonkers  So many programmes for children and adults to develop Irish traditions, music and language   💚   Delighted to visit them today, such talent. Maith sibh!   @helenajuly https://t.co/z2cDrqsCMS

Limerick-born @malachybrowne is a senior producer on the Pulitzer-Prize winning Visual Investigations Team @nytimes  Delighted to meet him and hear about cutting-edge investigative journalism methods @nytimes + insights into the reader's changing interests https://t.co/V2MW7JK2yN

In 2019, we welcomed 1.7m American visitors to the island of Ireland  Feedback from tour operators is positive as Americans plan holidays  Great to meet the @TourismIreland #NYC team and key agents & stakeholders https://t.co/XR6zA0ezIE

Director Martin McDonagh expertly captures the beauty & character of Ireland in @Banshees_Movie  I can't wait to see what US audiences think when the film opens this week   Very kind of Martin and the cast to feature in this @TourismIreland video 💚  https://t.co/GOh0aYrRpN

Happy 50th anniversary @IrishArtsCenter #NYC 🙌  Last night's gala was a celebration of Ireland's special bond with our diaspora  On behalf of the Government, I announced €1m towards the next phase of development at this important arts & cultural venue.   #SpiritOfIrelandGala https://t.co/t7Brt2fYrp
For more: https://t.co/FSidtim0z3
Today @gordonlyons1 and I submitted an expression of interest in the formal bidding process to the Tour organisers, ideally to host in either 2026 or 2027.

During my recent Belfast trip we agreed to express a joint interest in hosting three full stages of @LeTour   Hosting the world’s greatest cycle race would have significant tourism, sports and wider benefits for the island of Ireland.

The island of Ireland intends to pursue a joint North-South bid to host the opening stages of a future #TourDeFrance  @gordonlyons1 and I have discussed this on a number of occasions over the past year https://t.co/YHznbweI0w

A pleasure to welcome @AmazonStudios execs to @DeptCulturelRL today  They're visiting some of Ireland's best film & VFX locations this week! 📽️   We discussed new developments in sustainable film making, screen tourism plus Government's firm commitment to the Irish film industry. https://t.co/M5sU75AvkN
Delighted that these amendments for Committee and Report stages of the Online Safety & Media Regulation Bill were approved by my Cabinet colleagues today

Today was also a significant step forward in protecting women and girls online   My Cabinet colleagues approved my proposed amendment to empower the Online Safety Commissioner to tackle cyber flashing through online safety codes

There needs to be an improvement in the ratio of women to men on radio and TV  Today I brought measures to Cabinet that would promote gender balance in current affairs and music  This includes greater representation of music performed or composed by women on radio #MoreWomen https://t.co/jo3zovYLuo

All student grant maintenance holders will receive an additional maintenance payment by Dec 16th   This measure is part of the #Budget2023 package for students @SimonHarrisTD   For some students it means an additional €679 before the end of the year https://t.co/jB9PjxZ5Tp

Ireland is experiencing a resurgence in harp playing  To help meet demand and secure the future of our invaluable tradition, we introduced a tax relief for harp makers in #Budget2023  Here are some harp makers from across Ireland:  #HarpDay2022 https://t.co/oNk8OGe1P1 https://t.co/F54uH4fhwH

Last year when I launched the #SpeakUp report, I assured all of the respondents to the survey that their voices were heard  Today's launch of #SafeToCreate sets us on a path to transform workplace culture so that our artists and arts workers can feel safe in their workplaces.

@MindingCreative 🟢accountability -organisations found not providing a safe working environment will be disqualified from @artscouncil_ie & @ScreenIreland funding  Today's announcement is in response to @IrishTheatreIns's #SpeakUp report which revealed a culture of harmful workplace behaviour

To combat harmful behaviour in artists and arts workers' workplaces, we launched #SafeToCreate - a programme which includes:  🟢online resources 🟢training 🟢legal support 🟢report system 🟢research 🟢specialist trauma & abuse counselling @MindingCreative https://t.co/w0mC8FRPJl
@CatherineEmh @Longford_Leader @meabhc Congratulations @CatherineEmh on your inspiring work bringing cultures and communities together in Longford
For more: https://t.co/7byEJA6W0v

Today is the start of a transformation of our arts sector to ensure all artists and arts workers feel safe in their workplace  The Safe to Create programme we're launching today is in response to harmful behaviours revealed in @IrishTheatreIns Speak Up report https://t.co/uiyBUwfKm9

🟢4 days 🟢50 artists 🟢over 100 reps from agencies, labels, publishers, streaming platforms & more  @IrlMusicWeek is a valuable resource for our artists all thanks to @angela_dorgan & @FMC_Ireland  Delighted to be at @lostlanedublin earlier and speak to artists #IrelandMusicWeek https://t.co/BDxyIEayCl

https://t.co/mK79lUVcEq

Beidh seirbhís nuachta do pháistí i gceist, chomh maith le hábhar siamsaíochta, oideachasúil, drámaíocht, agus tógfaidh sé san áireamh páistí ó chuile chúlra agus ó chuile pháirt den tír ach go speisialta ar ndóigh iad siúd a labhrann Gaeilge, i bpobail a labhrann Gaeilge.

.@ForasnaGaeilge estimates this could create 150- 200 new jobs. There'll be no ads or sponsorship on the channel.  Ciallaíonn sé seo go bhfuil ardú suntasach ag teacht ar ábhar chraolachán do pháistí ó sé uair go leith sa lá go ceithre huair déag sa lá.

There'll be a new Irish language children's TV channel @Cula4_TG4 🙌   This will be provided for in the additional €7.3m I secured for @TG4TV as part of #Budget2023   -seo an méadú is mó ariamh ar mhaoiniú do TG4 https://t.co/qrpSCVp8Oe

🟢 Publicly-funded IVF will begin next year  🟢 VAT on period products has been reduced to 0%   This will be a help to women and girls across Ireland who are already contending with the unprecedented cost of living #Budget2023

As well as unprecedented cuts to childcare costs, #Budget2023 was important for women's equality:  🟢 Extension of free contraception scheme. Women aged 16-30 now eligible.  @greenparty_ie have long campaigned for universal free contraception, this announcement brings us closer. https://t.co/ZpETgMxd2q

#Budget2023 marks the most significant childcare investment in Ireland in the history of the State  @greenparty_ie & Minister @rodericogorman delivering in Government  🟢cuts to childcare fees 🟢improved working conditions 🟢increased parental leave https://t.co/vXBqT5mpml https://t.co/PIuR0tv9MQ

#Budget2023 also provides for   🟢€7.3m for @TG4TV   🟢a reduction of VAT for newspapers from 9% to 0%  🟢€6m for a new media grant fund, supporting local democracy & court reporting   🟢€7.5m to establish Coimisiún na Meán for online safety & media regulation

New measures for media announced today:   🟢 €15M will be made available this year for public service broadcasting, which will address the Future of Media Commission recommendation to provide interim funding to @RTE

@DeptCulturelRL Here are some topline funds I've secured for #Budget2023  Thank you to everyone from across @DeptCulturelRL's sectors for the close engagement with myself and my officials  Listening to your experiences was imperative as we work to contend with the challenges our country faces https://t.co/PXbwA8lrmf

The funding I've secured in #Budget2023 will support sectors under @DeptCulturelRL to continue to recover and grow  Ghabh muid tríd an ngéarchéim dheireanach; éireoidh linn gabháil tríd an gceann seo chomh maith le chéile. https://t.co/vXjPDAjxTD
